results.title: Age of turmoil
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
Focuses on the behaviour that reflects the emotional turmoil of early adolescence including giggling, destructive criticism of school, unrealistic ideas of their future, hours spent in seemingly useless activity. Most of the scenes are set in the home and show parents making appropriate and inappropriate responses. Different personality types, such as the leader and the quiet type have been selected to illustrate this budding stage. Produced for the parents of teenagers, not the teenagers themselves. Girls are chided for “their unrealistic ideas of their own future.” Boys are criticized for the way they “seem to spend hours in completely useless activity.”

results.title: Age of the mountain man
results.brief_description: Re-enacts the hardships of two trappers and their Indian scout during a few days in 1840. The mountain men trap beaver and trade pelts with friendly Indians. After contact with hostile Indians they reconsider their way of life. Gives the flavour of a transitional period in the westward expansion of the US.

results.title: Age of the Buffalo
results.brief_description: Uses paintings of the mid 19th Century to depict the era of the North American Plains Indian and the vast herds of buffalo that once grazed on the prairie.

results.title: Age of exploration: Spanish explorers
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Robert H. Black
results.brief_description: Depicts the discovery of America, through the eyes of the Spanish explorers. Discusses Spain’s reasons for exploration and shows the conquests of Cortez, Pizarro and others in the New World.

results.title: Agatha et les Lectures Illimitees
results.brief_description:
In a sprawling sea-side mansion, Agatha dialogues with her adored brother. Their impossible love, their common past come back to life as the conversation unfolds. Further viewing: ‘Duras filme’, an account of the making of ‘Agatha …’ - French Embassy Video Collection.

Credits: Director, Marguerite Duras ; writer, Marguerite Duras ; photography, Dominique Le Rigoleur ; music, Johannes Brahms.
Cast: Bulle Ogier, Yann Andrea, Margerite Duras [voice only].

results.title: Agam And
results.brief_description: Looks at Yaacov Agam, one of the world’s foremost Kinetic artists, who uses modernistic and moveable geometric designs in free moving metals, to depict his concept of life and of Judaism. Also deals with Agam’s unique concept of space and reality. Filmed in Israel, Paris and New York, his paintings and sculptures are shown. Music by Abraham Kaplan.

results.title: Against the tide
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Sumner, Interfilm and Robert Tronson
results.brief_description: Individual responsibility and teamwork are the twin themes in a film which links the continuous needs for safety precautions in the ever present dangers in life in the steel works and on the high seas.

results.title: Against all odds: the story of Australia's North West Shelf Gas Project
results.creator_credit: Woodside Petroleum Ltd and The Film House
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the North West Shelf Gas Project from the discovery of natural gas reserves in the 1970’s to the commissioning of a second off-shore platform in 1995. Highlights the successful export of liquefied natural gas to Japan.
